bboxes.raw_text:
For combination of oily and
dry skin, try a combination treat
ment - lots of soapsuds for the
oily patches, baby oil on the dry
areas.


For example, the nose and chin
are usually oily and tend to show
pimples and blackheads. After a
regular face-washing, coat them
with thick soapsuds lather, let it
set, then rinse with a washcloth
and cold water. On the dry areas,
such as cheeks, apply baby oil.

NEW YORK "A five page bib
biography Of articles on the Negro
market that have appeared in
business publications between
January, 1861 and January. 1864
has been released by D. Parke
Gibson Associates, Inc. New
York Negro market consultants
and publishers of The Gibson Re-
port on the Negro Market.


The photography contains 81
articles which cover the $685.
billion Negro consumer market.
and point up the sales potential
in a number of product categor-
les.


Copies of the photography are
available, without charge, from
D. Parke GIBBS on Associates Inc,
1921 Seventh Avenue, New York,
N. Y. IOO3o.

WASHINGTON = The Us. SUI
preme Court was asked to re-
verse the Alabama conviction OF
Rev. Fred l.. Shuttlesworth on
grounds that he was sentenced
for a crime without evidence OF
guilt.


lack Creenberg, director
counsel of the NAACP Legal De-
tense Fund, which has repre-
scented the civil rights crusader
on numerous other occasions,
argued the case.


1t grew out of an incident in
the Greyhound bus station in
Birmingham on May IL, 1861.
when Rev. Shuttlesworth accom-
panied a group of freedom riders
to the terminal.


The Legal Defense Fund S brief
reports that the freedom riders
we're standing at a bus stall,
apparently about to board when
Police Chief Jamie Moore came
up.


Chief Moore then announced
that all we're being arrested and
taken into 1.-THE protective Gus
tody Of the City Of Birmingham"


All we're arrested without re-
sistance and taken to city jail,
but Rev. Shuttlesworth was the
only one against whom charges
we're pressed.


Mr.. Greenberg and co-counsel
James M. Nabrit III argued that
Rev. Shuttlesworth was denied
due process of law by the Ala
bama Courts.


The Birmingham police "were
not exercising any legal duty when
they took the freedom riders in
protective custody )" the legal
defense fund brief asserts.


"There appears to have been
no such concept in Alabama law"
the Funds brief maintains, prior
to Rev. Shuttlesworth's arrest.


The Defense Fund attroneys
further assert that 1.-THE police
illegally arrested the freedom
riders while they (the riders)
we're exercising a federally pro-
tected right"

NEW YORK The March broad
casts of Negro College Choirs,
the ABC radio network series,
will feature choruses of five
southern colleges. the United Ne
gro College Fund announced.


The program originates in New
York City and is beamed by the
American Broadcasting Company
to it's affiliated stations each
week. Local stations air the pro-
gram on different days and times.
Check local newspaper listing for
air time.


The first broadcast of the
month, on Mar. l, featured the
Shaw University Chorale, Raleigh
NC. Succeeding broadcasts will
present Knoxville, Tenn, Mar. 8;
Lane College, Jackson, Tenn,
Mar. Is: Wiley College, Mar
shall, Tex, Mar. "a; and Virginia
Union University, Richmond. Va.
Mar. 81.


Negro College Choirs is in its
18th year of continuous broad
casting.

The first annual Family Of the
Year Award will be presented by
the Phoenix Urban League, Mar.
20, at the leagues annual meet
ing.


The award will be made for
achievements despite racial in
equities.


Religious, civic, social and
fraternal groups are invited to
send commentators to the Urban
League before Mar. II.

The next time boiled cabbage
is on your dinner menu, serve it
with this sparkling-good sauce.
Cut the cabbage into wedges
before boiling it, and pour the
hot sauce over each individual
serving.


MUSTARD CREAM SAUCE


8 Tablespoons butter


tablespoons flour


" teaspoon salt


u teaspoon pepper
IN cups milk


2teospoons prepared mustard
"a teaspoon Lea 6 Perrins


Worcestershire Souce


smell heed cabbage. cut In


wedges. cooked and droined
Melt butter In soucepon. Blend In
flour. solt and pepper. Add milk
slowly and cook over low heat, stir.
ring consistently until soucs 10 smooth
and thickened. Add mustard and
Worcestershire sauce; mix well.
Serve otop hot cabbage wedges.
Mokes Ia cups sauce. enough Tor
four servings.

The Interdenominational Eel
lowship Chorus Of First Institu-
tional Baptist Church presented
a Musicale Sum-, Mar. |, at 8
pm.


Mrs. A. G.. Kendrick was the
director and Mrs. j. Johnson,
pianist.

Mrs. magellan Allen, 5Oo2
S. 20 Place. was honored with a
surprise birthday party, >Satur-
day. Feb. %.


Her husband. Roy and other
relatives and friends kept the
secret for several days.

II was time for Saturday Feb. 49, friends gathered
help Edward publisher Of The Arizona Tribune
celebrate his seventh year American citizen


From Mrs. James Reed Roy Nixon Edward Banks ano
Capt. Alfred Daniels. Of Tempe.


Bottom photo from left includes Mesdames Alfred Daniels
Herbert williams Robert Bowman Mrs. Edward
Banks standing


Second photoCapt Daniels Jim Reed Drs Robert Bowman
and Herbert Williams.
